text: Santiago Manuin Valera (1 January 1957 - 1 July 2020) was a Peruvian human rights activist and indigenous leader. He was born in Condorcanqui Province, Peru. He was a key leader of the Aguaruna people in Peru. He was President of the Committee for the Struggle for Respect for Indigenous Peoples of the Condorcanqui. He was a critic of the Túpac Amaru Revolutionary Movement. Manuin Valera died on 1 July 2020 from COVID-19 in Chiclayo, Peru at the age of 63.Fallece líder awajún Santiago Manuin a causa de la COVID-19 en Chiclayo ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Peruvian politicians Category:Human rights activists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Peru
title: Santiago Manuin Valera
